projects.title: Palate
projects.description: Palate is a full-stack MERN (MongoDB, Express, React, Node.js) application that transforms user inputs‚Äîeither natural language or uploaded food images‚Äîinto complete recipes. The app supports authentication, dietary preference customization, and visualizes ingredients, steps, and images. It reflects my progression into building end-to-end intelligent web applications.

projects.title: ExpressInk
projects.pathLabel: Hackathon project for a good cause
projects.description: Built during a socially-driven hackathon, ExpressInk helps identify children's emotional states through their drawings using AI-powered computer vision. It leverages React for the interface and Node.js for backend logic. Designed to assist in autism screening, it showcases both technical and empathetic problem-solving skills.

projects.title: Premier League Predictor
projects.description: This project applies machine learning and statistical techniques to analyze historical Premier League data and forecast season outcomes. It demonstrates my capability to wrangle large datasets, extract meaningful patterns, and deploy predictive models with interpretability.

projects.title: Inventory360
projects.description: Inventory360 is a secure, scalable inventory management system designed for an organization with 12 distributed locations and over 1000 users. It features a highly interactive and user-friendly frontend, robust data validation using Zod, secure MongoDB integration, and a real-time asset tracking dashboard. It reflects my ability to build professional-grade software used by large, distributed teams.

projects.title: Brick'd Up
projects.description: Brick'd is a 2D platformer built in C# using the Unity game engine, featuring inventive level mechanics and engaging gameplay. The game was built as part of a university team project and is now published on Itch.io. It reflects my creative instincts, ability to collaborate, and capacity to deliver polished, user-focused software.

research.title: KV Cache Compression in Transformers
research.description: Exploring KV cache compression in transformers using mathematical tools like singular value decomposition (SVD) and dynamic rank adjustment. This work contributes to reducing memory usage during inference on large language models without significant loss in quality.
research.projectDescription: Chunk-wise SVD compression for transformer KV caches. Low memory usage, high accuracy on HPC GPUs using Dockerized environment.
